snippet: The losses on Wall Street, at less than 1 percent, were lower than in the euro zone markets, where declines ranged from 2.2 percent in Germany to 5.2 percent in Spain.
abstract: Stocks fall for a fourth consecutive day after European Central Bank president Mario Draghi disappoints investors hoping for immediate action to contain Europe's debt crisis.
lead_paragraph: The losses on Wall Street, at less than 1 percent, were lower than in the euro zone markets, where declines ranged from 2.2 percent in Germany to 5.2 percent in Spain.

headline.seo: Stocks Fall Again on Lack of Action to Contain Europe’s Debt
headline.main: Shares Continue Losing Streak for Week as Europeans Fail to Act on Debt Crisis
headline.print_headline: Shares Continue Losing Streak for Week As Europeans Fail to Act on Debt Crisis
